subject: Re: [junit] fundamental questions on JUnit
msgSnippet: ... I should have qualified that further to be writing tests first _and_ removing all duplication. Mike -- Mike Clark Clarkware Consulting, Inc.
messageBody:
Alain Ravet wrote:

> Mike Clark wrote:
>
> >If I only write new code when a test is failing, I should never have an
> >untested path in new code.
> >
> I'm afraid you forgot refactoring.
> When simplifying your code, you can make it work though fewer paths,
> while not removing the no-longer needed ones.
> Their uselessness would not jump to your face, as all the tests would pass.
>
>

I should have qualified that further to be writing tests first _and_ removing
all duplication.

Mike

--
Mike Clark
Clarkware Consulting, Inc.
http://www.clarkware.com
720.851.2014
